intro.content:
Hello friends!

How was your week? Mine was full of highs and lows, but on the bright side we got our doggo back to our place!

Regarding this week edition, there is quite a lot of long read articles in there. So, pro-tip if it's taking you too long and you feel rather bored or hungry: jump directly to the end of this newsletter for a tasty surprise.

Flex!

hero.title: The discovery that transformed Pi
hero.description: For thousands of years, mathematicians were calculating Pi inefficiently. Then Newton came along  and changed the game.
hero.why:
'Oh no, not again a nerdy video for the Highlight of the week!' I already hear you say.

Well yes, I won't lie it's about Mathematics. But, but, but bear with me, it also involves üçï and a story of Newton making great discoveries while being in lockdown. So, in the end, it's actually a very nice video ;-)

randomArticles.title: Three ways the pandemic has made the world better
randomArticles.description: COVID-19 has inflicted devastating losses. It has also delivered certain blessings.

randomArticles.title: What working from home looks like around the world
randomArticles.description: From a florist in Tehran to a chef in Bangkok, meet nine workers who turned their homes into makeshift offices.

randomArticles.title: Who is Alexey ‚ÄúThe Machine‚Äù Molchanov, the world‚Äôs best freediver?
randomArticles.description: After an accident, Alexey Molchanov¬†is on a mission to go deeper than he's ever gone before.

randomArticles.title: Senior citizens link up with language students in lockdown
randomArticles.description: ShareAmi scheme aims to combat the isolation felt by many older people during the pandemic

animalCorner.title: Finish him!
animalCorner.description: Think your were good at Street Fighter, think again!

animalCorner.title: A rare white Peacock displaying its feathers
animalCorner.description: It's Sheng from kung fu panda 2

recipe.title: The Invention of a New Pasta Shape
recipe.description: Cascatelli is designed to maximize the three qualities by which Dan believes all pasta shapes should be judged: Sauceability, Forkability, Toothsinkability
